Element.name: Action
Element.Description: An Action is a reference to the business logic defined by an Action Definition. The attached Action Events are thrown caught when the business logic completes (either correctly of with an error condition).
Element.Action: Goes to the Action Definition that this Action refers to.

PropertyCategory.name: General
PropertyCategory.Property: If checked, this action is executed when the ancestor App View is accessed.
If checked, this action is executed when the ancestor Site View is accessed.
If checked, a flow will appear in the corresponding landmark menu that will activate this action. If the caught action evnet has no outgoing flows, the final target page is the last visited page.
If checked, the access to this action is permitted only to users belonging to a group entitled to access it.
If checked, all the flows whose navigation can activate this action are implemented using the secure HTTP protocol, instead of the HTTP protocol.
The Action Definition to which this Action refers.

PropertyCategory.name: Appearance
PropertyCategory.Property: A distinctive icon displayed in the diagram and in the outline.
If checked, all parts belonging to this action will be displayed.
